722322f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 69th Street
722322f-a.text:
Perk Avenue, east side, between 69th and 70th Streets, showing Nos. 709, 711, 713 Park Avenue. 709 end 711 will be stending in 1935.
About 1912.
Nea w2a2

722318f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 69th Street
722318f-a.text:
Park Avenue, west side, north from 69th Street, showing at left the George S. Blumenthal residence, at S.W. corner of 70th Street. The buildings of old Presbyterian Hospital, between 70th and 71st Streets, are about to be demolished. On the N.W. coner of 71st Street stands the G.S. Brewster residence, which will be replaced by an apartment house. The tall apartment building on the N.W. corner of 72nd Street, in the right background.was erected in 1921.
March 31, 1V28.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

714258f-a.title: Manhattan: 69th Street (East) - Park Avenue
714258f-a.text:
109 (left) to 127 (small house at right) E. b9th Street, north side, between Park and Lexington Avenues, as viewed northward from the site of old Hunter College. The 11 story apartment house on the right margin bears No's 129 E. 69th Street and 944-952 exington Avenue, and is at the N.W . corner. The Union Club is to the left
and does not app6ar.
April 25, 1938
P. L. Sperr

722320f-b.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 69th Street (East)
722320f-b.text:
Park Avenue, east side, south from E. A9th Street (right, not shown in No. 1). The apartmert buildings seen hegir at 68th Street and occupy the 68th-67th and B7th.88E 4r98t blocks; the Seventh Regiment Armory being on the 56th-6Sth Street block. Upor the cleared area seen at the left, stood the old Hunter College. This has recertly been derolished. Vfew No. 2 is southeastward across this site and hows the annex of same on the Lexington Averue side of tuis block.
April 25, 1838.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

714260f-a.title: Manhattan: 69th Street (East) - Park Avenue
714260f-a.text:
105-109 East 69th Street, north side, east of Park Avenue.
About 1912.

722323f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 69th Street (East)
722323f-a.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from E. 69th (left) to 70th Streets, as viewed northeastward from the Vacant lot on the east side of
this thoroughfare,between 68th and 69th Streets.
Two low builoings occupy the above location; that at the S.W. co ner of 70th ltreet 1s the George S. Blumenthal resucence. To the north of same is a modern apart..ent house standing on the old Presbyterian Hospital site. At the right margin appears a portion of the Union Club, located at the N. E. corner of Park Evenue and E. 69th Street. Hunter College until recently occupied
the cleared foreground area.
April 25, 1938
P. L. Sperr

722319f-b.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 69th Street
722319f-b.text:
(1)
Park Ave., at the M.E. corner of 69th Street, showing the structure which in August 1933 was to become the new home of the
Union Club.
June B, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same at a later date, showing the changed aspect of this building that now bears No's. 701-7 Park Ave. and 101 East 69th
Street.
June 12, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view of the 69th Street side, as photographed from the clearance on the opposite side where the old Normal College for Women (Hunter College) stood. Park Ave. is on the left in this
instance.
April 25, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
